newsitem.title: UK: Scott Pickford says talks price with suitors.
newsitem.headline: Scott Pickford says talks price with suitors.

text.p: British geoscience service company Scott Pickford Plc said on Monday it was still in discussions with two interested takeover suitors -- Core Laboratories of the U.S. and Australia's Aerodata Holdings Limited -- to establish a price at which a deal could be done.

Core had proposed an initial offer to shareholders at 53 pence per share but Aerodata, which had already entered into a cross-shareholding and co-marketing agreement with the company, said it would consider making a bid at the same price.
Earlier today Core said it would increase it bid to 57 pence on condition that the share exchange or any such deal with Aerodata does not go ahead.

In its statement, Scott Pickford said it reiterated its advice to shareholders to take no action, adding "the board is still discussing the offer and possible offer with Core and Aerodata respectively with a view to establishing a price at which (it) could recommend an offer to shareholders".
It added it was keen to resolve the matter as soon as possible and would keep shareholders informed.
